page.title: 02THE TOWN OF NEWPORT
page.content: {Newport}first became a{Borough}in 1835, and was{chartered}in 1963. The Borough of Newport badge has a red chevron with creatures with wings that are part fish on either side. The motto "terra marique", which was adopted in 1958, means "by land and sea." In 1936 the Newport Borough Council decided to build a new{civic {centre.}At this time Newport had its own{Police Force}and was responsible for providing{magistrates courts.} On four walls in the civic centre there are murals depicting the{history of the area since the first celtic settlements. Newport has a{population}of 135,000 which extends over a 77 square mile area of the southern part of the county of Gwent in south east Wales.
